webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the Christmas and New Year holiday period between 22 Dec and 26 Jan.

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access.

Walking trails may also be closed due to total fire bans and/or risks, so plan ahead. 

Roads or car parks may close within the Royal National Park when they reach capacity.

The following locations may be affected:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach car park
  • Bonnie Vale day use area
  • Garie Road between Sir Bertram Stevens Drive and Garie Beach car park
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will manage access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - Christmas & New Year holiday period

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads

properties.otherAdvice: The festival will be held at Rotary Park from Wednesday 14 to Monday 26 January and will include stalls and shows over the course of the event. With an increase in pedestrians, motorists are advised to take note of traffic and event signage.

properties.publicTransport: Trains, light rail and buses run regularly to Parramatta within walking distance of the Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Tens of thousands of people are expected to attend Australia Day events in Parramatta Park from 4pm to 9.30pm on Monday 26 January.

Traffic delays are expected throughout the Parramatta CBD and surrounding the Park as attendees travel to and from the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time, and exercise caution as there will be increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
Westmead

From 4pm to 10pm, Wednesday 31 December 2025 (local access maintained)

  • Alfred St between Railway Pde and Queens Rd
  • Central Ave between Railway Pde and Queens Rd
  • Park Ave between Railway Pde and Caroline St

Parramatta

From 8:30pm to 10pm, Wednesday 31 December 2025

  • George St between O’Connell St and Marsden St
  • Hunter St between O’Connell St and Pitt St (Westbound) (Managed exit from Hunter St Carpark will occur from 8:30pm under traffic control)

  • Pitt St between Argyle St and Macquarie St (Northbound)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

webLinks.linkText: NBL: Sydney Kings v Tasmania Jackjumpers

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip and allow extra travel time.
properties.otherAdvice:
Upcoming NBL matches at Qudos Bank Arena:

  • Thu 22 Jan - NBL: Sydney Kings v Tasmania Jackjumpers. Tip off at 7.30pm, finish around 9.30pm.
  • Sun 25 Jan - NBL: Sydney Kings v Adelaide 36ers. WNBL: Sydney Flames v Adelaide Lightning match at 12pm, NBL: Sydney Kings v Adelaide 36ers match at 2.30pm, finish around 4.30pm.
  • Thu 29 Jan - NBL: Sydney Kings v Illawarra Hawks. Tip off at 7.30pm, finish around 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans make their way to and from Olympic Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Upcoming indoor dance festivals at Sydney Showground

  • HTID on Saturday from 5pm until midnight.
  • Meltdown on Sunday from 5pm until midnight.

With thousands of people expected, attendees are encouraged to plan their trip and consider all the available travel options ahead of time.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the events. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

webLinks.linkText: A League Men: Macarthur FC v Melbourne City FC

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Melbourne City FC at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

webLinks.linkText: A League Men: Newcastle Jets v Wellington Phoenix

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets FC v Wellington Phoenix at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick off at 7.35pm and finish at approx. 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow.

For passenger drop-off, use the allocated 10-minute loading zone in the McDonald Jones Stadium car park. Entry is via the driveway off Turton Road.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
Bridge Street (New England Highway) will be closed between John and King streets between 10am and 12pm for the Australia Day Parade.
properties.diversions:
There will be a detour for light vehicles via John, Maitland and King streets.


The detour is not suitable for heavy vehicles. B-Doubles traveling from the north on Thunderbolts Way will be held at Rocky River Road during the event. Oversize and over mass vehicles will be parked on Bridge Street between John and Park streets for northbound vehicles and between King and Hill streets for southbound vehicles.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds at The Domain Sydney from 6.15pm to 11pm on Friday 23 and Saturday 24 January.

With thousands of people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St.

Motorists should avoid driving through the area or expect delays and detours and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

If you are catching rideshare or taxis, use the dedicated drop-off location on Hospital Road at Art Gallery Road. For pick-ups after the event head towards Elizabeth Street or Sir John Young Crescent.  

Roads around The Domain Sydney will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event.

The following roads will be closed from 8pm to midnight (approx)

  • Art Gallery Road from Hospital Road to Mrs Macquarie Road

The following roads will be closed from 10pm to midnight (approx)

  • St Marys Rd from Prince Albert Road to Sir John Young Crescent
  • Prince Albert Road from Macquarie Street to Art Gallery Road
  • Hospital Road from Art Gallery Road to Shakespeare Place
  • Cathedral Street at St Marys Road

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Mardi Gras Fair Day at Victoria Park in Camperdown from 10am to 9pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavy on roads approaching Victoria Park including on Parramatta Rd, City Rd, Cleveland St and Glebe Point Rd as attendees travel to and from the event throughout the day.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 5am to 9.30pm at the following locations:

  • City Rd between Carillon Ave and Parramatta Rd (western side)
  • City Rd between Cleveland St and Butlin Ave (eastern side)
  • Parramatta Rd between City Rd and University Ave (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Ferries will be affected during the day and night due to exclusion zones on the harbour. Buses will also be diverting and using different stops due to road closures. Light rail will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall from 7.30pm to 10.30pm. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around Circular Quay, The Rocks and in Milsons Point will close during the day and evening for Australia Day events in the city and around the harbour.

Key road closure timings:

  • 4am to midnight – Circular Quay & The Rocks: Sections of Argyle St, Circular Quay West, OPT Elevated Rd, Essex St, George St, Harrington St and Lower Fort St 
  • 7am to 10am – Barangaroo & Millers Point: Sections of Barton St, Hickson Rd and Towns Pl for the OzDay 10k
  • 7am to midnight – The Rocks: Hickson Rd* between Pottinger St and George St. *Note: No heavy vehicle access to Hickson Rd north of Pottinger St between 4am and 7am due to the closure of George St south of Hickson Rd and lack of turnaround area.
  • 10.30am to 1pm – Milsons Point: Olympic Dr between Broughton St and Alfred St South 
  • 7.30pm to 10.30pm – Sydney CBD North: Sections of Albert St, Alfred St, Circular Quay East, Conservatorium Rd, Loftus St, Macquarie St, Phillip St, Pitt St, Reiby Pl, Young St and other surrounding streets 
  • 7.30pm to 10.30pm – Cahill Expressway closed in both directions: including lanes 7 & 8 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Circular Quay Overpass, the High St and Mount St on-ramps, on and off ramps at Macquarie St and the on-ramp at Domain Tunnel. Lane 4 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge will also close and the speed limit on the bridge will be reduced to 40km/h during this time. There will be no direct access from the Sydney Harbour Bridge to the Domain Tunnel. 
  • 9.15pm to 10.15pm – Sydney CBD North: Grosvenor/Bridge Street between Lang Street and Pitt Street  

The Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass walkway will be closed from 5pm to 9:30pm. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will remain open.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks between 3am and midnight and throughout the CBD from 5pm until 10.30pm. Clearways will also be in effect on Olympic Dr between Broughton St and Alfred St South in Milsons Point from 9.30am to 1pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.diversions:
Heavy & Oversize vehicles: while the Cahill Expressway is closed 7.30pm to 10.30pm Oversize & Dangerous Goods vehicles travelling southbound on the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be detoured via York Street or the Western Distributor. Access to the Eastern Distributor (height limit 4.4m; no dangerous goods) will be via York Street, King Street, Elizabeth Street, Park Street and William Street to the Bourke St on-ramp. Vehicles not carrying dangerous goods can use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel (height limit 4.4m), which remains open in both directions during the event. Vehicles travelling north or south of the city are encouraged to use Victoria Road and the Gladesville Bridge to avoid traffic delays on the following detour routes in the city:

Operators of restricted access heavy vehicles are advised to check the relevant network map on the NHVR National Network Map to determine a suitable approved detour.

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Macquarie Street, Olympic Drive
roads.suburb: Circular Quay, The Rocks, Milsons Point

properties.publicTransport:
The free "Gong Shuttle" bus (routes 55A and 55C) runs every 10 minutes in a loop around Wollongong making stops at North Wollongong Station, Fairy Meadow Station, Gywneville and Wollongong University and Innovation Campus. 

Gong Shuttle buses will run every 10 minutes from 7am until 11pm on Australia Day. The closest stops to the celebrations at Belmore Basin are along Corrimal St and Burelli St.

Due to road closures, the Free Shuttle Bus will travel along Corrimal Street instead of Cliff Road.

From 8pm until 10pm buses that usually run along Crown St and Burelli St will terminate and depart at Burelli St (west of Corrimal St).

Route 887 will not run along Cliff Rd due to road closures, the service will be be detoured along Burelli St, Corrimal St, Campbell St, Church St and Bourke St.

Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Australia Day Aquathon will once again take place along the Wollongong foreshore, with events running from 6am to 12pm. Wollongong's Australia Day event will then start at 4pm and conclude with fireworks at 10pm.

The following road closures will be in place from 4pm until 10pm:

  • Cliff Rd between Marine Dr and Georges Pl
  • Harbour St between Market St and Cliff Rd
  • Hector St
  • Hinton St
  • Campbell St from Corrimal St to Wilson St
  • Wilson St
  • Smith St between Corrimal St and Harbour St
  • Market Pl

The following road closures will be in place from 8pm until 10pm:

  • Marine Dr
  • Endeavour Dr
  • Crown St from Harbour St to Marine Dr

The Red Hot Summer tour music event will be held from 12.30pm to 9pm at Speers Point Park. Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the area as attendees travel to and from the event, with increased pedestrian activity.
properties.diversions: Following the event, northbound traffic will be diverted via Main Road.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ocean Alley at The Domain Sydney from 5.30pm to 11pm on Saturday 31 January.

With thousands of people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St.

Motorists should avoid driving through the area or expect delays and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

If you are catching rideshare or taxis, use the dedicated drop-off location on Hospital Road at Art Gallery Road. For pick-ups after the event head towards Elizabeth Street or Sir John Young Crescent.  

Roads within and around The Domain Sydney will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event.

The following roads close from 8pm 

  • Art Gallery Road from Hospital Road to Mrs Macquarie Road 

The following roads close from 10pm at the direction of NSW Police.

  • St Mary’s Road from Prince Albert Road to Sir John Young Crescent 
  • Prince Albert Road from Macquarie Street to Art Gallery Road 
  • Hospital Road from Art Gallery Road to Shakespeare Place 
  • Macquarie Street from Hunter Street to Prince Albert Road 
  • St James Road from Elizabeth Street to Macquarie Street  
  • College Street from Park Street to Prince Albert Road 
  • Cathedral Street at St Mary’s Road

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Perth Wildcats at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 8pm, full time around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the match.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Southern Cross Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12.25pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets and additional light rail services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header: Sydney FC v Western Sydney Wanderers. ALW Kick-off at 5pm, ALM kick-off at 7.35pm, finish around 9.20pm.

With up to 30,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavy on approach and within Moore Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.   
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Road and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road. Car Parks open from 4.30pm. 
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street and Lang Road, and from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland Street.   

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Melbourne Victory at polytec Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the match.

Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed from 3.30pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip and allow extra travel time.
properties.otherAdvice:
UFC 325 at Qudos Bank Arena on Sunday from 8.30am, finish approx 3pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as attendees make their way to and from Olympic Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details.

properties.otherAdvice: Australia Day event will be held from 4-9pm at The Entrance Memorial Park. Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the area as attendees travel to and from the event, with increased pedestrian activity.

webLinks.linkText: North Sydney Streets CBD After Dark event

properties.publicTransport: Metro services and buses run regularly to Victoria Cross at the festival site. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the North Sydney Streets CBD After Dark event from 4am to 9pm on Friday.

Local roads in North Sydney CBD will close from 11am Friday to 1am Saturday including:

  • Denison St between Berry St and Mount St
  • Spring St between Denison St and Little Spring St
  • Mount Street will be partially closed from Denison St to Walker St.

Street parking will be also be restricted within the event footprint.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport: .Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Lunar Streets Festival on Saturday 14 February. Event starts at 5pm and finishes at 10pm.

  • Sections of Campbell St, Factory St*, George St*, Harbour St*, Hay St, Kimber Ln*, Little Hay St, Little Pier St*, Sussex St*, Thomas Ln, Thomas St and Ultimo Rd will be closed between 8am Saturday 14 to 1am Sunday 15 February.
  • Sections of Harbour St*, Hay St and Sussex St will also be closed from from 6am to 12pm on Friday 13 and Monday 16 February.
  • *Note: Managed access will be in place for residents and businesses during the specified times.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am Saturday 14 February on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St and Sussex St, and from 10am Saturday 14 February on sections of Campbell St, Thomas Ln, Thomas St and Ultimo Rd. All clearways will be lifted by 1am Sunday 15 February.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Extra light rail services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
BBL Challenger: Sydney Sixers v Hobart Hurricanes at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Start of play at 7.15pm and end of play at approx. 10pm.

With up to 25,000 cricket fans expected, ticketholders are urged to catch public transport and leave the car at home to avoid traffic delays and the high demand for parking. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group and allow extra travel time. Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel in the already busy Friday evening peak, on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.  
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road. Car parks open from 4.15pm.
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion Street, Lang Road and Moore Park Road, and from 6am to midnight on Cleveland Street and Fitzroy Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

High volumes of holiday traffic are expected approaching and through Nowra, Jervis Bay, and Milton/Ulladulla during peak holiday travel periods.

For details about known holiday traffic pinch points, see the NSW Holiday and Journey planning website and the pinch point journey planning tool.

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW Interactive road closure and clearway map - Sun Run

properties.publicTransport: Routes 166, 167 and 177 buses will divert or end trips early while roads are closed along the course. Visit transportnsw.info for more info and to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of participants are expected to take part in the annual Sun Run event. The 10km run starts at 6:30am and the 7km run starts at 7.30am, both from The Strand in Dee Why with both events finishing at Manly Beach by 10am.

Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect starting at 3:30am. All roads will reopen by 11am. 

Residents along the course are urged to plan ahead and relocate their vehicles outside the road closure footprint if vehicle access is required on event day. There will be limited vehicle movements permitted while the event is underway. 

ROAD CLOSURES

  • Dee Why – from 3:30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde, The Oaks Ave westbound crossover will be maintained at The Strand until 6.15am.
  • Dee Why – from 5:15am to 9am: sections of Oaks Ave, Pacific Pde, Boronia St, Griffin Rd and Monash Pde will be closed.
  • North Curl Curl to Freshwater – from 5:30am to 9am: sections of Abbott Rd, Griffin Rd, Headland Rd, Pitt Rd, Adams St, Carrington Pde, Charles St, Evans St and surrounding local roads will be closed. Crossover points will be maintained on Pacific Pde at Griffin Rd, Playfair Rd at Pitt Rd, Ross St at Pitt Rd and Headland Rd at Griffin Rd until 6:15am.
  • Freshwater to Queenscliff – from 5:30am to 10am: sections of Lumsdaine Dr, Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Dowling St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd and surrounding local roads will be closed. Managed westbound exit on Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am to 6:30am and from 9:15am to 10am.
  • Manly – from 5:30am to 10am: sections of Bridge Rd, Cameron Ave and Collingwood St will be closed.
  • Manly – from 3:30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads will be closed.
  • Manly – from 3:30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde will be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3am until 9am on roads along the course through Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly, including on sections of Abbott Rd, Howard Ave, The Strand, Evans St, Crown Rd North Steyne and South Steyne.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicle cross overpoints have been established to facilitate resident access where possible. To ensure the safety of participants, these points will be closed to vehicles while runners pass through.

CROSSOVER POINT CLOSURE TIMES // Managed by Police & traffic controllers

DEE WHY

  • Oaks Ave westbound only - local access permitted until 6.15am
  • Pacific Pde at Griffin Rd (both directions) - local access permitted until 6.15am

NORTH CURL CURL

  • Headland Rd at Griffin Rd (both directions) - local access permitted until 6.15am
  • Playfair Rd at Pitt Rd (both directions) - local access permitted until 6.15am
  • Ross St at Pitt Rd (both directions) - local access permitted until 6.15am

CURL CURL

  • Adams St at Carrington Pde westbound only - local access permitted until 6.15am

QUEENSCLIFF

  • Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St (both directions) - Managed exit permitted 5:30am - 6:30am, and between 9:15am - 10am. Road Closed 6:30am - 9:15am
  • Cameron Ave - managed exit until 6:30am

NO ACCESS LOCATIONS

  • DEE WHY & NORTH CURL CURL – residents between the course and the coastline will have no access while crossover points are closed.
  • CURL CURL & FRESHWATER – residents of cul-de sac roads off the western side of the course will have no access until roads reopen.
  • QUEENSCLIFF – residents between the course and the coastline have no access while crossover points are closed.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Parramatta Eels fan day at CommBank Stadium from 5pm to 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the event. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Pregnancy Babies & Children's Expo at Sydney Showground on Saturday 31 January and Sunday 1 February. Event runs from 10am to 4pm daily.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Perth Glory at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 7pm, finish around 8.55pm.

Please note due to weather conditions for Sunday 25 January, the timing of the event has changed. Plan ahead

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.
